text: So, fish pie. This one has evolved into something very beautiful.
My first job is to make something called a temper.
So I've got two chillis here, finely slice those
And then I've got four cloves of garlic, now I'm gonan slice up the four cloves- Hello!
Do you wanna come see what I'm doing
You're getting heavy
OK, we're making fish pie
OK you ready?
This is groundnut oil, or sunflower oil
Four, five tablespoons in a pan
Add two small handfuls of curried leaves and one and a half tablespoons of black mustard seeds to the pan.
Go in with the garlic, and then the chilli
Then fry the temper for five minutes.
I'm putting aside half the temper to use later as the finishing touch on my pie
To the rest, I'm adding two finely chopped onions
One and a half teaspoons heaped of tumeric, one and a half teaspoons of fenugreek, and let that toast off.
Add a finely chopped, thumb-sized piece of ginger, then cooked down til softened.

That's one tin of?
Coconut Milk.
Coconut milk, yeah.
Fresh spinach- two hundred grams of it.
And add the zest and juice of half a lemon
Then leave the curry to simmer and thicken up
Are you singing a song? I'm trying to do a recipe mate.
You alright?
Pour your curry into a nice-looking, high-sided baking dish
And leave it to cool whilst you deseed and roughly chop four tomatoes.
Give them a little season and I'm gonna sprinkle that into our lovely yellow sauce
Next, the fish
I've got my haddock, you can use any fish
Salmon. I've got three sides of lemon sole here, and they're like double fillets
Because it is about texture and fun
I'm just gonna roll up the fish. They look really beautiful like a little rose
Six large prawns, and I'm gonna sprinkle these in and around
Two hard boiled eggs, sliced into quarters complete the base
Now the mash potato topping
Made with 1.2 kilos of Maris Pipers boiled in seasoned water
Add two nice nobs of butter
We'll season it
Milk, just a little bit. Stop!
Mash the potato until there are no lumps left at all.
You can of course just pile on the potato, but piping makes it look good and most importantly it's fun to do
Nice job Buds, yay! High five
Good lad
Bake for 40 minutes at a 180 c til golden and bubbling
Yes!
I've got the temper here, sprinkle it over the top
That is a great fish pie
